Source code for dcsControllerServer.untitled0

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""
Created on Wed Jun 27 15:33:17 2018

@author: Basti
"""



[docs]def check_uint(value, bitlength=64):
    print('Checking value')
    if value is None:
        return True
    elif not isinstance(value, int):
        raise TypeError(f'Expecting integer and not '
                        f'{value.__class__.__name__}.')
    elif value not in range(2**bitlength):
        raise ValueError(f'Value must be smaller than 2**{bitlength}, but it '
                         f'is {value}.')
    return True




[docs]class UIntField:

    def __init__(self, bitlength=64, val=None):
        self.bitlength = bitlength
        self.val = val

    def __get__(self, obj, objtype):
        print('Invoking setter')
        return self.val

    def __set__(self, obj, val):
        print('Invoking setter')
        check_uint(val, self.bitlength)
        self.val = val

    def __set_name__(self, owner, name):
        self.name = name




[docs]class TestClass:

    def __init__(self):
        self.x = UIntField(8, 42)

    def __getattribute__(self, name):
        attr = super().__getattribute__(name)
        if hasattr(attr, '__get__'):
            return attr.__get__(self, self.__class__)
        return attr

    def __setattr__(self, name, value):
        try:
            obj = object.__getattribute__(self, name)
        except AttributeError:
            pass
        else:
            if hasattr(obj, '__set__'):
                return obj.__set__(self, value)
        return object.__setattr__(self, name, value)



if __name__ == '__main__':
    tc = TestClass()
    print(tc.x)
    tc.x = 21
    print(tc.x)
    tc.x = 'abc'
    print(tc.x)
